Description: Limestone ostracon with remains of 11 lines of text on the recto and 10 lines on the verso containing a legal document (testimony?).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Egypt Exploration Fund (probably from the Excavation 1910-11)
Bibliographic references: Biedenkopf-Ziehner 2000a / Koptische Ostraka I: Ostraka aus dem Britischen Museum in London (161-166, pl.15)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (82880) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/82880)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Phoibamon (son of Viktor)
Named in inscription: Johannes (son of Patlol)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. II 14 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
